qas.question: Where did the monks flee to?
What monastery did the Saint-Evroul monks establish in Italy?
Who patronized the monks in Italy?
What tradition were the Saint-Evroul monks known for?

context: At Saint Evroul, a tradition of <a3_0><a3_1>singing<a3_1/><a3_0/> had developed and the choir achieved fame in Normandy. Under the Norman abbot Robert de Grantmesnil, several <b4_0>monks<b4_0/> of Saint-Evroul fled to <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>southern Italy<a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, where they were patronised by <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>Robert Guiscard<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> and established <a1_1>a <a1_0>Latin monastery at <a1_2>Sant'Eufemia<a1_2/><a1_1/>.<a1_0/> There they continued the tradition of <a3_2>singing<a3_2/>.
